content: First PR, mildly confused about the process. In particular I'm failing some of the CI checks, but the failures look like python errors and not something I can fix (or if it is, I don't understand how)
Maybe it helps if you remove the empty file you added
And you should also use the mk all script to add the other new file to Mathlib.lean
... Oops. Yeah, I thought I'd unstaged that...
thanks for the tip about mk all, I wasn't aware of that
Okay, looks like it's just waiting on the build now; thanks!
... Huh. simp only [...] is discouraged? I've been leaning towards it when possible for the sake of performance/compilation times...
oh, no, I was misunderstanding the error, nvm
Looks like this is ready for review now, if anyone wants to take a look

@Robert Maxton You are not assuming that the AiA_iAi​ are commutative, right? I think that is worth stressing in the module docs.

@Eric Wieser Do we have anything in the direction of indexed tensor products of rings/algebras in other places?
Sure, I can do that tomorrow. And yes, we have Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.PiTensorProduct of modules. But this is the free product.
(how do you do the fancy docs links?)
Prepend docs# to the name
In the commutative case, that PiTensorProduct is the coproduct in algebras as well, right?
Right. You only need the free product for noncommutative algebras.

Great... my understanding of the noncommutative case is very brittle.

So... could you also add the isomorphism between these two constructions in the commutative case?
Or at least, indicate this as a TODO, and possibly implement it in a follow-up PR?

Sure, I'm planning to do a followup with that empty file I removed to show that the existing FreeAlgebra for general Types is equivalent anyway.

(as the PR mentions it just doesn't have the nice API for alghom stuff)
(#14858 for mobile)

mmmm
It's a shame Mathlib doesn't likeλs, because I do :< :p
fixed, though
also, working in the Mathlib containers, I notice that hitting 'enter' to accept a suggestion actually inserts a carriage return, which it doesn't do in my own windows
any idea what that might be about?
anyway, all mentioned issues so far have been addressed

Robert Maxton said:

also, working in the Mathlib containers, I notice that hitting 'enter' to accept a suggestion actually inserts a carriage return, which it doesn't do in my own windows

The default vscode settings have been overwritten in mathlib, rather controversially

bleck
I did in fact check the settings but I saw both 'tab' and 'enter' there, but 'enter' doesn't seem to work
how can I fix this?
You can modify the .vscode/settings.json file and not commit it
Or find the existing thread and ping saying it is annoying
#12749 is the offending PR, which links to the thread
I shall do both -_-
